No.CAS-10(4)/2003.Div.1
BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION)

GOVERNMENT OF INDIA
AAWING ,JANPATH BHAWAN,
JANPATH, NEW DELBI 120001

Date = 10.1.2003

AVSEC ORDER NO. 1 /2003

In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation
Notification No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997 Commissioner of Security (Civil
Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security for the purpose of securing the
safety of aircraft operation directs that passengers may be allowed to carry
their hand baggage while proceeding for identification of registered baggage
provided that:-

i) Security checked registered baggage shall be properly strapped and
sealed by the airlines.

ii) — APS Unit and airlines security staff shall exercise strict surveillance
during identification of registered baggage to ensure. that passengers
do not open the registered baggage or any part thereof.

AZ
tela
(PK. Mitra)

Commissioner of Security (CA)
